module.name: TreeFilterEdit
module.short: Implements a control used to filter an associated TTreeView control.

descr.p: treefilteredit.pas contains classes and other types used to implement a control used to filter an associated TTreeView control. treefilteredit.pas is part of the LazControls package.

element.name: TImageIndexEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler used to get the position of the image for a tree node.

descr.p: TImageIndexEvent is an Integer object function type which specifies an event handler signalled to get the position for an image associated with a tree node in a tree view control. Arguments passed to the object method indicates the text for the tree node, it data, and its enabled state in the tree.
The return value contains the ordinal position for the image selected for a tree node. It is stored in both the ImageIndex and SelectedIndex properties for the TTreeNode instance.

TImageIndexEvent is the type used to implement the OnGetImageIndex event handler in the TTreeFilterEdit control. The event is signalled when TTreeFilterBranch sorts, filters and displays the tree nodes on its TTreeFilterEdit and TTreeView controls.

element.name: TImageIndexEvent.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the image selected for a tree node in the event handler routine.

element.name: TImageIndexEvent.Str
element.short: Text for the tree node used in the event handler.

element.name: TImageIndexEvent.Data
element.short: Object reference with the data for the tree node.

element.name: TImageIndexEvent.AIsEnabled
element.short: Returns True if the tree node is enabled.

element.name: TFilterNodeEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled to determine if a tree node matches the Filter in a TTreeFilterEdit control.

descr.p: TFilterNodeEvent is a Boolean object function which defines an event handler used to determine whether a tree node can be used in a TTreeFilterEdit control. TFilterNodeEvent is the type used to implement the OnFilterNode property in TTreeFilterEdit.
TFilterNodeEvent can be used to determine whether a specific tree node is visible (or matches a filter value) using criteria other than the text or data for the TTreeNode instance.
ItemNode is the TTreeNode instance examined in the handler, and provides access to its properties and methods.

Done is an output parameter which indicates whether the tree node was examined in the handler routine. Set Done to True if the node was used or examined in the handler. Set Done to False if the node was not / could not be handled in the routine.
Set the return value to indicate whether ItemNode matched the filter value and is visible in its filtered tree view control. Its value is significant when Done is set to True.

element.name: TFilterNodeEvent.Result
element.short: True if the specified tree node can be used for the Filter value.

element.name: TFilterNodeEvent.ItemNode
element.short: Tree node examined in the handler routine.

element.name: TFilterNodeEvent.Done
element.short: True if the node was handled in the routine. False if the node was ignored in the handler. The return value is significant when Done is set to True.

element.name: TTreeFilterBranch.Move
element.short: Moves the tree node and data at the specified position to the position in NewIndex.

descr.p: Move is a method used to change the ordinal position for a tree node and its associated data in the root node for the branch.
CurIndex contains the ordinal position for the tree node relocated in the method.
NewIndex contains the new ordinal position for the tree node.

Move changes the value in the Index property for the TTreeNode instance to NewIndex to reorder the tree node in the branch. It also moves data for the tree node supplied by the caller using the specified ordinal positions.

Move calls the MakeVisible method in the TTreeNode instance to ensure that it is visible on the Tree View control (when assigned). If the Tree View control is not assigned, the parent nodes for the tree node are expanded to make the node visible in the tree.

element.name: TTreeFilterBranch.Move.CurIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the tree node and data moved in the method.

element.name: TTreeFilterBranch.Move.NewIndex
element.short: Ordinal position where tree node and data are relocated in the method.

element.name: TTreeFilterBranch.Items
element.short: Contains the original tree node data for the class instance.
element.p: Items is a read-only TStringList property which contains the original data displayed for a branch in a filtered tree view control. It contains data for the tree nodes stored using AddNodeData, and maintained using GeteData / DeleteData / FreeNodeData / ClearNodeData. Items is used when the tree nodes are sorted and filtered in the class instance.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit
element.short: Implements a filter edit control for an associated TTreeView control.

descr.p: This control has 2 different modes of operation. One mode maintains and filters sub-items of root-nodes in a tree. The other mode filters the whole tree using the TreeNode.Visible property for each of the nodes.
Mode 1: Sub-branches under root nodes Items for each branch are maintained in a TTreeFilterBranch class instance.

Mode 2: A whole tree When no branches are defined (no calls made to GetBranch), the TreeFilterEdit control filters the whole tree automatically. It uses the Visible property in the TTreeNode instances to show/hide it.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.SortAndFilter
element.short: Sorts and filters either branches or the whole tree depending on the operation mode for the control.

descr.p: SortAndFilter is an overridden method in TTreeFilterEdit which implements the abstract virtual method introduced in the TCustomControlFilterEdit ancestor. It ensures that the SortAndFilter method in TTreeFilterBranch instances is called to sort and filter selected branches in the control (when assigned). If the internal TBranchList has not been assigned, the ApplyFilterCore method is called to filter the entire tree.
SortAndFilter is called (from the ancestor class) when the value in Filter is applied to the nodes in the tree.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.ApplyFilterCore
element.short: Applies the Filter to branches in the tree view or the entire tree depending on the mode of operation for the control.

descr.p: ApplyFilterCore is an overridden method in TTreeFilterEdit. It implements the abstract virtual method introduced in the TCustomControlFilterEdit ancestor.

ApplyFilterCore is used to apply the value in Filter to either the entire list of nodes or the selected child node branches in the tree view control. When child tree nodes have been selected, the filter is applied using the TTreeFilterBranch list.

If the entire list of tree nodes are the target, the nodes are expanded when ExpandAllInitially is enabled and the method is called for the first time. The tree nodes are recursively filtered and the Visible property for the nodes is updated as required for the Filter value.
ApplyFilterCore is called from methods in the ancestor class when an idle state is detected and the control has pending updates for the filter value, or when the ForceFilter method is called.

The BeginUpdate and EndUpdate methods in the FilteredTreeview control are called to reduce the number of screen updates as the filter value is applied to tree nodes. The ClearInvisibleSelection method in the tree view is called to hide the selected tree node if it is no longer visible for the new filter value, or to clear multi-selections when the new filter is applied.
No actions are performed in the method if a value has not been assigned to the FilteredTreeview property.

element.short: Stores the first visible node for the selected tree node in FilteredTreeview to the SelectionList property.

descr.p: No actions are performed in the method for the following conditions:

ul.li: FilteredTreeview does not have a Selected tree node.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.RestoreSelection
element.short: Makes the tree node in SelectionList the Selected node in the FilteredTreeview control.

descr.p: No actions are performed in the method if FilteredTreeview has not been assigned.
Raises an assertion exception if SelectionList has more than one node in the list.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.GetExistingBranch
element.short: Get an existing branch for a given tree-node, or Nil if there is none.

descr.p: This can be used only with the "sub-branches" mode.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.GetCleanBranch
element.short: Get a new or existing branch with data cleared for a given tree-node.

descr.p: This can be used only with the "sub-branches" mode. In fact calling this method switches the filter into "sub-branches" mode. This is the way to add those branches.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.DeleteBranch
element.short: Deletes the branch with the specified root node from the internal list.

descr.p: DeleteBranch iterates over the items in the internal branch list to locate an entry with the root node specified in ARootNode. The delete method in list is called to remove the branch entry.
No actions are performed in the method if an internal TBranchList has not been allocated in the class instance by calling the GetCleanBranch method.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.DeleteBranch.Result
element.short: Returns True if the specified branch node was successfully removed from the internal list. Returns False if a branch with the specified root node is not found, or the branch list is empty.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.DeleteBranch.ARootNode
element.short: Tree node that represents the root node for the branch deleted in the method.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.ImageIndexDirectory
element.short: Ordinal position for the image displayed for a directory entry in the list of tree nodes.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.SelectionList
element.short: List of selected items in the FilteredTreeview control.

descr.p: SelectionList is a read-only TStringList property with the list of selected items in the FilteredTreeview control. It is used to save and restore selected item(s) when the Filter is (re)applied to the items for the control.

An existing value in SelectionList is cleared prior to saving a new tree node in the StoreSelection method. The value in SelectionList is used in the RestoreSelection method to locate the node and restore it to the Selected property in FilteredTreeview. The current implementation does not handle multiple selections in the property; a single selected tree node can be stored or restored using the property.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.ShowDirHierarchy
element.short: When filtered text is a directory name, it is split and shown as a tree structure.

descr.p: ShowDirHierarchy is a Boolean property which determines whether directories and / or files are displayed using a tree structure. It is used when the SortAndFilter method is called to sort original data into the sorted order used when applying the Filter value for the control.
ShowDirHierarchy has effect only in the "sub-branches" mode. The "whole tree" mode uses the existing tree nodes as is and only changes their visibility.
Changing the value for the property causes the InvalidateFilter method to be called. An Exception is raised if a TCustomTreeView instance has not been assigned to the FilteredTreeView property.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.FilteredTreeview
element.short: The associated TTreeView with the filtered tree nodes for the control.

descr.p: FilteredTreeview is a TCustomTreeview property with the associated tree view for the filter control. FilteredTreeview is used to display the tree nodes which match the Filter for the control. Assigning a new value to the property causes the InternalSetFilter method to be called to update the Button for the control and apply the Filter to the tree nodes using the value in Text and the OnFilterNode and OnFilterItem event handlers.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.ExpandAllInitially
element.short: Tree branches are expanded also initially.

descr.p: The branches are expanded in any case when the tree is filtered and matches are found. This setting only affects the initial state.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.OnGetImageIndex
element.short: Gets the ordinal position for the image displayed for a node on the control.

descr.p: OnGetImageIndex is a TImageIndexEvent property with the event handler signalled to get the position for the image used for a tree node displayed on the control. The event handler includes the following arguments:

dl.dd: Object instance with the data for the tree node.
Variable parameter which indicates whether the tree node is enabled on the control. True when enabled, otherwise False.

descr.p: OnGetImageIndex is signalled (when assigned) from the ApplyFilter method in TTreeFilterBranch. The return value provides the value stored in the ImageIndex property for the TTreeNode instance, and refers to the ordinal position in the Images property for the control. -1 indicates that an image (and its position) could not be determined using the specified argument values.

element.name: TTreeFilterEdit.OnFilterNode
element.short: Event handler signalled to determine if a tree node matches the Filter for the control.

descr.p: OnFilterNode is a TFilterNodeEvent property with the event handler signalled to determine whether a tree node matches the Filter value for the control. The event handler is signalled (when assigned) when the filter value is recursively applied to tree nodes to determine which are visible in the FilteredTreeView. It allows user-specified criteria other than the text or data for the node to be used to determine node visibility.

OnFilterNode is signalled when the ApplyFilterCore method is executed, and occurs after setting the value in Filter property or when the SortAndFilter method is called. An application must implement and assign a handler using the signature in TFilterNodeEvent to determine the visibility for a tree node and its child nodes.

OnFilterNode is signalled before the OnFilterItem event handler. The Done output parameter indicates whether the node was processed in the event handler. The return value indicates whether the node is visible (matches the filter). If the Done argument is set to False, the OnFilterItem event handler is signalled to check visibility for the node using its text and data. If the Done argument is set to True, the OnFilterItem handler is not signalled and the return value from the handler determines the visibility for the node.
